titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Justice of the Peace, Robert Jones
CWG1742

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.

To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:
Know Ye, That Robert Jones having been duly appointed JUSTICE OF THE PEACE, for Owen County, in District, No. 9 In the place of Robert Garvey refused to qualify, I hereby invest him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of the said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereunto legally appertaining, until his successor is duly qualified according to law.

In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 8th day of Dec, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 63, and in the 72nd year of the Commonwealth.

Tho. E. Bramlette
BY THE GOVERNOR:
E. L. VanWinkle, Secretary of State.
By Jas R Page
Asst Sec

Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.
Kentucky Owen County Sct
To His Excellency Gov Bramlette

The undersigned would respectfully state that owing to old age ill health and other pressing personal engagements he is unable to attend to the duties of the office of Justice of the Peace in District No 9 in Owen county -- he therefore most respectfully declines to accept of said office April 11th 1864

Owen Co
Resignation of R. Jones
J P.
&
appointed
Thos W. Stewart
12th Apl/64
